, about 45 minutes north up the Gulf of Mexico coast from
.  It's right between Copano Bay to the west, on the coast of Aransas Bay.  Aransas Bay is around 4 miles wide at this point, with the Gulf of Mexico beyond.

The primary way to enter Rockport is via Corpus Christi then Portland. Take Highway 181 to 35, in Rockport turn on Business 35. It's approximately 3.5 hours south of San Antonio.  Be careful, the roads seem to be heavily patrolled by police.

There is also a very nice airport near
, just a few miles north, though Corpus Christi is the nearest commercial airport. Many of the major airlines fly into Corpus, though most flights originate in Houston or San Antonio.
Local transit seems to largely be via automobile.
, which has some really good restaurants.

value: content=Along Fulton Beach, Cajun style fresh seafood, served dumped on butchers paper on your table. Extremely good food and service. It looks pretty questionable from the outside, but that's all for appearances. $15 per person for the Cajun Combo.
content= Very good, Authentic Mexican food, lunch around $8 per person.
directions=South of the main town, take the right fork as leaving town
content= Fantastic food, reasonably priced. Horrible service, expect to spend 2 hours for lunch if they're at all busy. Lunch around $12 per person.
content=Coffee shop, serving breakfast and lunch, good coffee drinks. Su-Th:6AM-9PM, F-Sa: 6AM-12AM.
directions=Go south on 35 business 5miles to hwy 188. Go rt on 188 1/4 mile on rt.

, Views of the bay, a smallish motel (not hotel like most Holiday Inn Expresses).  Along the main drag in town, with a park to the south and the gulf across the street to the east.  The whole hotel is covered by free Wireless Internet.
content=Three story waterfront motel on Aransas Bay. Suites, kitchenettes, and cabins. $99-$150 a night, discounts for weekly/monthly stays.
content=Bay-front motel with its own 500 foot fishing pier and swimming pool. $55-90 a night including breakfast, discounts for longer stays.

content=The Surf Court Motel sits on the water's edge of beautiful Aransas Bay in downtown Rockport. Family oriented, short walk from local shopping and dining, pet friendly, swimming pool, lighted 420' fishing pier, and kitchenette rooms with a water view. Other rooms have small refrigerator and microwave. Amazing location, simple furnishings and extremely affordable.
content=Copano Cottages offers ten pet-friendly cottages ranging from 1 bedroom to 3 bedrooms and includes parking for boats.

North of town across the bay is the
, which includes a tree over a thousand years old, a huge fishing pier, and free WiFi Internet access from the Visitors Center.  Day passes are available for $2 per person.
WiFi is rare here.  The Holiday Inn Express is one of the few places that has free WiFi.  The town is well covered by Sprint CDMA.

value: offers some additional attractions and lodging.
